turns.text: All right what type of things would you fix if youre having company come over
turns.label: o

turns.text: Well I have really great one that I make in the summertime because its cool and its uh its just really pretty easy Its pretty much dumping things in and stirring
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And I like that Uh the only thing you have to do is cook the rice that goes in in it and then I youre supposed to do chicken but I just use those little cans of chicken
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And it makes it so much easier and so you dump the rice you dump the chicken and then you put in fruit like pineapple and mandarin oranges and grape now grapes are the ones that you have to pull all that off but I get my kids to do that so -
turns.label: sd

turns.text: I I dont have to do that And um and it really - and you mix it all up with ye- - theres little dressing that goes in it that you have to stir up but its so simple and it tastes really good because its cool in the summertime
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Oh yeah You serve it cold
turns.label: b

turns.text: Yeah it has to sit in the fridge over night but but its really good
turns.label: b

turns.text: Yeah Usually when we entertain we do something really simple because I like to visit with my company
turns.label: b

turns.text: and not be scurrying around in the kitchen so
lot of times well barbecue like uh for Memorial Day we had some friends over and we just bought brisket and marinated it overnight in one of those like Adolphs meat marinate
and put it on the smoker and cooked it
And tha- it was real good You can buy fairly cheap piece of meat that way and then people think theyre eating steak or something
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah yeah And these days that helps doesnt it
turns.label: b

turns.text: I dont usually I just pass on any recipe thats got more than five or six steps to it because I just know Ill never take the time to do it
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Now spaghettis such an easy one Um I do that lot
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah it seems like most people like spaghetti
turns.label: b

turns.text: Yeah I dont like to do that i- if its ho- real hot though
turns.label: b

turns.text: Because um I dont know I have real thing about being hot in the in the summertime
turns.label: h

turns.text: Well I think when you heat your kitchen up it really makes big difference
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Yeah I think thats right And um we dont entertain that often but when we do Im like you I like it to be fast and easy
turns.label: aa

turns.text: And something so that we can talk and not --
-- and not have to worry about being in the kitchen all the time
Most - we dont entertain like people from work or stuff - often Its usually friends from church and stuff
and its usually kind of like you want to come over and they say well what can we bring
turns.label: sd(^q)

turns.text: And so its real easy because you just make one or two things and everybody else brings something
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Thats exactly like us from our church we just do it yeah
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Its lot more relaxing I dont know if I could take the pressure of having to - you know put on this really fancy dinner for someone
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Well you see all that on and I could never be that person
turns.label: sd

turns.text: It just uh Im just not - well Im so Im pretty laid back

And uh you know so I dont I know lady in my church and uh she like does her own bread and does her own stuff and so when she um does food she really goes all out and I dont know how she can do it and be calm
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Do you stay home with kids
turns.label: qy

turns.text: Yeah I Ive been working were going to have baby this summer and Im not going to work anymore
turns.label: b

turns.text: Yeah So hopefully I think Ill enjoy cooking more when I dont have to work all day I dont like to come home and stand in the kitchen and spend an hour fixing something and then have to clean it up and by then its eight thirty or nine oclock at night so -
turns.label: b

turns.text: Yeah Well I usually start about six and an and cook and then eat at seven
turns.label: b

turns.text: I mean co- cook at five and eat at six rather
Yeah and uh my family and I were sit down together family
turns.label: b

turns.text: Uh yeah I dont like the run in and out part
turns.label: b

turns.text: And I like to be able to sit down after school and have them talk with me an and my husband about whats happened and
turns.label: sd

turns.text: I think I that was ingrained in me during my family time at home
And uh you know we could learn to talk about things and I think thats good
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah that really is It keeps the family in touch with whats going on with each other
turns.label: aa

turns.text: Right now we eat in front of the but since its just the two of us its -
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah yeah Well that happens to us sometimes too
turns.label: b

turns.text: But uh sometimes if something uh is on that they want to watch I leave it on but we eat in the kitchen and their heads are always poking past the door
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah Anyway food is is uh real life-style kind of thing and i- some people dont like to do this but I like to co- uh cook with my kids
turns.label: b

turns.text: And if theyre going to have other kids over then then they help And we make real simple things you know those oh - I don- I dont know if youve ever made them maybe not since you dont have kids yet but those Jell- uh gelatin things you can pick up with your fingers I cant think of what they call it
turns.label: sd

turns.label: sd

But they like that with the the cool ranch dressing that goes along with that

turns.text: Do you cook breakfa- like you cook breakfast every morning or -
turns.label: qy

turns.text: Uh not every morning uh mostly during the summer its hit and miss and
turns.label: ng

turns.text: we usually have like uh cold cereal or something like that

Um during the su- during wintertime when theyre in school um then I try to vary it so that we only eat that like twice twice week or something and then have like when its really cold I even cook oatmeal
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Because I like oatmeal and the loo- they like it all right
And um then sometimes we do something it has to be fast because theyre on their way to school we do like Eggo waffles and stuff like that but -
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah so I try to uh - and sometimes we do eggs if I get up early enough to do that I used to do them in the microwave but they dont like that
turns.label: b

turns.text: Oh do they get rubbery or -
turns.label: qy

turns.text: It de- it depends If you let them cook too long --
turns.label: no

turns.text: -- then theyll turn little bit gray You can tell if theyve gone to long because theyll turn little bit gray and they will be little harder and I dont like that
So you have to just let it cook little bit less than what it says in if you have microwave book but you cook it little bit less and then let it sit with like plate over the top
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And then and then stir it up
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah an and that turns out okay
turns.label: b

turns.text: And its funny cause if I turn them out on to di- i- on to like plate for them to take what they want --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- they dont know Ive ever done it in microwave Its really funny its very deceiving you know cause if they see it with their eyes they go uh I dont like want that
you know and yet if they dont ever see it th- then its like oh this tastes okay you know so -
We had - my grandmother used to do that to us with things like squash Everybody would say we dont like squash we wont eat squash so she would make these fancy casseroles and hide it in there you know
turns.label: sd

turns.text: and then wed go oh this is really good
